channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #123 - Advent started
item.description:
Hi,

The week started with very few articles but in the last 2-3 days, people started to write tons of interesting stuff. In addition, Advent started and with that the advent calendars. You'll have plenty of material to read or watch.

Enjoy!

item.title: We're Hiring Perl Software Developers - Grant Street Group
item.description:
We're a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications.
We're looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.
Email resume: 106686-CS-6734@grantstreet.hrmdirect.com

item.title: Perl 5 Optimizing Compiler, Part 10: Kickstarter & Performance Benchmarks
item.description: Will Braswell (Will_the_Chill) is running a fund-raiser for the RPerl project. As I understand, it is a very optimized Perl 5 compiler implementing part of the language. What Will calls the low magic commands. It was also discussed on Reddit.

item.title: Perl One-Liners has been published by No Starch Press
item.description: This is the announcement of Peteris Krumins himself. AFAIK the Perl Weekly discount code is still valid. (It is PERLWEEKLY)

item.title: DWIM Perl for Linux 5.18.1
item.description: This is a Perl distribution for Linux. The first release of the new series of releases that come with C libraries as well. This version comes with XML::LibXML (and thus libxml2). Just download, unzip and you can use it. List of extra CPAN modules on the site of DWIM Perl for Linux

item.title: The xdg channel - Thanksgiving missive
item.description: Look, new toys! David Golden worked on quite a few CPAN modules lately without blogging about them. Now he collected the list: Class::Tiny, Path::Tiny, MooseX::Role::MongoDB,CPAN::Common::Index just to mention some of them.

item.title: Perl in Banks
item.description: Is Perl a secret weapon in Banks? Do any of them admit it? Can you find people who work at some of the largest money-making institutions that heavily rely on Perl. Dave Cross reposted a request for some 'proof that Perl is indeed used in the finance industry' and he got quite some. Now how can you turn this into money?

item.title: Why Are Fast Tests Important?
item.description: Great story by Ovid about the BBC, and why reducing the test run-time can increase the productivity of your team.

item.title: Including CPAN Testers results in the adoption list
item.description: The CPAN adoption list ranks modules how important it would be for you to step-up and volunteer to maintain them. It takes into account several factors, and starting from now, it also includes the test reports collected by the CPAN Testers.

item.title: New Perl::Critic policy in the pipeline: RequireParamsValidate
item.description: In the last few weeks there seem to be a lot of action around Perl::Critic people creating new policies. This time Jonas Nielsen has written a policy for checking for the use of Params::Validate.

item.title: Decoding radio-controlled bus stop displays
item.description: Ron Savage pointed out that there was a discussion on Slashdot about a bus service in Helsinki, Finland that broadcasts the data for the tram stop display system. Oona RÃ¤isÃ¤nen took the lead and reverse engineered the data. Using some Perl code.

item.title: New Perl Graphing library and competition from Plot.ly
item.description: Plotly offers a graphing library for scientific Perl/PDL. I don't see a dead-line, but they plan to announce the winner on 29 December 2013, so you better send your graphs in the next 2-3 weeks.

item.title: Interesting Slides on Perl and concurrency
item.description: John Napiorkowski, the current leader of Catalyst recommends us to go over the slides of Jonathan Worthington on the concurrency model of Perl 6.

item.title: Computer Programming in 5 Minutes
item.description: Part of the BigThink interview series of Larry Wall.

item.title: Building your first app using MongoDB and Perl
item.description: This time with comments and links.

item.title: Happy Advent!
item.description: Oylenshpeegul collected the list of Advent calendars: Go, Perl 5, Perl 6, Dancer, Futures, Sys, Java, Garage Rock.

item.title: Day 01 â€“ The State of Perl 6 in 2013
item.description: In Perl 6 land, 2013 will be remembered as the year that brought proper concurrency support....

item.title: Semantic Perl
item.description: Perl and the Semantic web. Introducing RDF::Trine and RDF::Query

item.title: Futures can return values synchronously
item.description: LeoNerd (aka. Paul Evans) will cover the Futures module during this Advent.

item.title: How to improve my Perl program?
item.description: It is especially for beginners, but even long time Perl users might find a few suggestions here. Certainly you could use this page to recommend your co-workers some basic things how to improve their Perl code.

item.title: German Perl Workshop (GPW 2014)
item.description: March 26-28, 2014, Hannover, Germany

item.title: YAPC::NA 2014
item.description: June 23-25, 2014, Orlando FL
